intro: Jussiaea longifolia f. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered jussiaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a slightly hairy surface. This plant is native to regions of South America, particularly in Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
